DataElement.preferredName: Image Study Attending Physician Full Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Names of the physician(s) who are responsible for overall patient care at time of Study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose._The physician responsible for the administration and medical care a patient receives. The physician may have the added responsibility of supervising resident physicians or medical students, and involving consulting physicians in the prescribed plan of care.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: The physician responsible for the administration and medical care a patient receives. The physician may have the added responsibility of supervising resident physicians or medical students, and involving consulting physicians in the prescribed plan of care.

Concepts.definition: The physician responsible for the administration and medical care a patient receives. The physician may have the added responsibility of supervising resident physicians or medical students, and involving consulting physicians in the prescribed plan of care.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/6/14 - Released as part of caBIG Draft Content review. jc  12/26/06-Created new DEC to reflect relationship of patient care physician to an image study based on 2006 DICOM standard

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: PN: A character string encoded using 5 component convention, each of 64 characters.  Components order is: Family name, Given Name, Middle Name, Prefix, Suffix.  "^" used to identify a null component. [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal.:A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal.

A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
